result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casondra K. McCracken

records.addlTxt:
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 

Defendant will be in Fond Du Lac at an ATR during the PTC. 
State is in compliance with victim rights legislation and no victims appear today.

3:22 PM Defendant Casondra K. McCracken appeared by video, in custody at the Wood County Jail.   Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Casondra K. McCracken.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Soule was not able to complete the written waiver but did have a conversation with her client over the phone and explained the waiver of the Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:33 PM 
Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Casondra K. McCracken.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls the case and states appearances.
ADA Mutchler makes statements and requests an adjournment of this matter.
Atty Soule concurs and requests that the defendant be transported to Portage County for the next hearing.
Court notes the District Attorney's Office should handle that.

BY THE COURT:
Matter adjourned.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
